xs.$description: Zero breakpoint. Will be renamed to common.dimension.breakpoint.zero in a future version.

mini.$description: Functional minimum breakpoint to ensure accessible reflow of content once magnified, zoomed or otherwise heavily constrained on ultra-small viewports. Will be renamed in a future version.

sm.$description: Small breakpoint, below which content is likely to be displayed on a mobile device (in portrait orientation) or equivalent viewport.

md.$description: Medium breakpoint, below which content is likely to be displayed on a mobile device (in landscape orientation) or equivalent viewport.

lg.$description: Large breakpoint, below which content is likely to be displayed on a tablet, mobile device (in landscape orientation) or equivalent viewport.

xl.$description: Extra-large breakpoint, below which content is likely to be displayed on a tablet or handheld device, small-screened desktop or laptop computer, or equivalent viewport.

xxl.$description: Extra-large breakpoint, immediately either side of which content is likely to be displayed on a tablet, small-screened desktop or laptop computer, or equivalent viewport.

xxxl.$description: Extra-large breakpoint, above which content is likely to be displayed on a large high definition tablet, high definition desktop computer display.

0.$description: Zero-value token for use in padding, margin, gap or other applications where preset spacing is desired.

1.$description: Minimum non-zero value token for use in padding, margin, gap or other applications where preset spacing is desired.

2.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc. Default value for space between inline text elements.

3.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

4.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

5.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

6.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

7.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

8.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

9.$description: Spacing token for use in padding, margin, gap, etc.

10.$description: Maximum value token for use in padding, margin, gap or other applications where preset spacing is desired.
